thread.title: How to Prepare, Just in Case You Die Young

author: Chana R. Schoenberger
title: How to Prepare, Just in Case You Die Young
text:
Few estate plans consider the possibility of an early death. That is a potentially disastrous mistake, experts say.
By the time youâ€™re in your 40s, you likely know someone, or know of someone, who has died young. That is why it is important for people to draw up plans as soon as possible, including accounting for what will happen should death occur in middle age, with children still at home.
